metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3695 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
markup.c in the MXit protocol plugin in libpurple in Pidgin before 2.10.10 allows remote servers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a large length value in an emoticon response.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3695` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

finch - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.2
libpurple-bin - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.2
libpurple0 - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.2
pidgin - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.2
pidgin-data - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pidgin package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.2').
